item.title: Tree roots lifting pavement, 5th November

item.title: Rubbish in road and pavement, 5th November
item.description:
Regular piles of bags left on pavement and in road. Absolute mess on a daily basis.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58-60, Berners Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic lights making junction unsafe for pedestrians and cyclists, 5th November
item.description:
The phasing of the temporary traffic lights is giving very long hold ups to pedestrians trying to get across roads. This is leading to a lot of pedestrians stepping into the road against their lights because they need to get some where and a very long wait is very frustrating. Also drivers are jumping though lights as they go red which is putting cyclists in advance stop boxes moving when the cyclist light goes at risk. Overall I think the junction has become very unsafe for pedestrians and cyclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Russell Square, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping and piles of rubbish, 5th November
item.description:
Yet again less than a week and the rubbish is building up and stinking. It’s disgusting and horrendous..! It’s blocking the footway making it difficult for women and pushchairs to get by. It is also encouraging the rats to feed at this massive Bait station.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, St Stephen's Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
